column3: $First game at Target Field, MinneapolisFILENAME_TX"

replay,5,camem001,BOS,tscht901,MIN04,F,N,I,,H $Mike Cameron hit a fly ball down the LF line that went between the pole and the limestone facing of the stands; it was ruled a foul ball by 3B umpire Kerwin Danley; Red Sox manager Terry Francona asked about the ruling, so crew chief Tim Tschida looked at the replay and upheld the call; the gap between the pole and the wall is very narrow; first replay in the fifth inning of the first game in the park2010MIN.EVA.regular.comment.csv"

$after the throw to the plate Red Sox catcher Victor Martinez threw to 2B attempting to put out Denard Span; Nick Punto, who had stopped at 3B, scored on the throw to 2B2010MIN.EVA.regular.comment.csv"

$catcher Lou Marson retrieved the ball after the wild pitch and threw it in the dirt to pitcher Justin Masterson, who was covering the plate; Delmon Young rounded 3B and scored when the ball got away from Masterson2010MIN.EVA.regular.comment.csv"

replay,5,keara001,CLE,tscht901,MIN04,O,N,I,,H $Austin Kearns' fly hit the top of the wall and bounced back onto the field; the Indians asked about the call so crew chief Tim Tschida watched the replay and upheld the call2010MIN.EVA.regular.comment.csv"

replay,4,kinsi001,TEX,gormb901,MIN04,F,Y,I,,H $Ian Kinsler's fly down the LF line was just foul but called a home run; the Twins asked about the play so crew chief Brian Gorman watched the replay and overturned the call2010MIN.EVA.regular.comment.csv"

replay,3,yound003,MIN,gormb901,MIN04,F,N,I,,H $Delmon Young hit the 1-1 pitch down the RF line; the ball hit on the top of the wall about 2 feet foul and was called foul; the Twins asked about the call so crew chief Brian Gorman looked at the replay and upheld the call2010MIN.EVA.regular.comment.csv"
Rangers pitcher Derek Holland left the game due to an injured shoulder2010MIN.EVA.regular.comment.csv"

$Denard Span ran from 2B towards 3B without tagging up; Nick Punto, who was part way to the plate, turned and yelled to Span to go back to 2B; Punto trotted towards the plate, thinking that his run would not count because the third out was going to be made at 2B; however, if he had crossed the plate before the out at 2B, his run would count; after the game, he admitted to not knowing the rule2010MIN.EVA.regular.comment.csv"
Braves second baseman Omar Infante left the game due to an injured foot2010MIN.EVA.regular.comment.csv"
$the pitch deflected off Ryan Spilborghs and hit HP umpire Jerry Crawford on the right foot; the Twins trainer checked him before the game resumed2010MIN.EVA.regular.comment.csv"

$the pitch deflected off Brad Hawpe and hit HP umpire Jerry Crawford on the left shoulder; the Twins trainer checked Crawford again; Crawford took a few minutes to recover; Twins catcher Drew Butera talked with Crawford, who patted Butera on the back before they resumed2010MIN.EVA.regular.comment.csv"
Twins pitcher Kevin Slowey left the game due to an injured ankle2010MIN.EVA.regular.comment.csv"

ej,gardr001,M,marqa901,Call at 3B on missed tag $Kelly Shoppach ran to 3B on the single to LF; Delmon Young's throw beat Shoppach by at least eight steps; Shoppach stopped running so Michael Cuddyer moved over and tagged Shoppach, or so he thought; Shoppach ran to 3B and said something to 3B umpire Alfonso Marquez about no tag; Marquez called Shoppach safe; Twins manager Ron Gardenhire argued the call and was ejected by Marquez2010MIN.EVA.regular.comment.csv"
White Sox right fielder Carlos Quentin left the game due to an injured hand2010MIN.EVA.regular.comment.csv"
Indians left fielder Austin Kearns left the game due to an injured knee2010MIN.EVA.regular.comment.csv"

replay,4,yound003,MIN,demud901,MIN04,O,N,I,,H $Indians left fielder Trevor Crowe jumped at the wall attempting to catch Delmon Young's fly ball; it hit his glove and bounced off the wall then came back down where Crowe caught it and immediately threw to the infield; it was ruled no catch; the Twins asked if it was over the wall, so the umpires huddled and crew chief Dana DeMuth watched the replay and upheld the call2010MIN.EVA.regular.comment.csv"
Debut game for Anthony Slama2010MIN.EVA.regular.comment.csv"

replay,5,casia001,MIN,hallt901,MIN04,O,Y,I,,H $Alexi Casilla's fly ball hit the top of the wall and caromed off the metal railing behind the flower bed; the ball bounced back onto the field and was ruled in play; Casilla stopped at third; the Twins asked about the call so crew chief Tom Hallion watched the replay and overturned the call to a home run2010MIN.EVA.regular.comment.csv"
